data.description: Database Management Intern Mentor: Director, Revenue & Sales Operations Location: United States, Remote (Candidates must currently reside in the United States and be authorized to work here. We are unable to consider applicants located outside the U.S. or candidates who would require current or future sponsorship at this time.) Full Time: up to 40 hours/week This is a twelve (12) week internship program starting in May 2026. Candidates must be enrolled in college during the internship with a graduation date after August 2026. Position Summary Join our team this summer and gain hands-on, real-world experience supporting our sales and marketing operations through data management and CRM optimization. As a Database Administrator Intern, you’ll work directly with our Sales Operations and Technology teams to maintain, troubleshoot, and enhance our Salesforce CRM platform—one of the core tools driving our business decisions and customer relationships. You’ll play a key role in improving data integrity, streamlining workflows, and enabling our teams to make smarter, faster, data-driven decisions. This internship offers the opportunity to see how clean, organized, and actionable data fuels growth across a dynamic organization. What Will You Work On? (Sample Projects) You’ll contribute to meaningful projects that make an impact. Examples include: Data Quality & Integrity: Identify and merge duplicate records within Salesforce (contact, account, and opportunity levels) to improve accuracy and usability. Data Enrichment: Audit Salesforce data for missing or incomplete information and use a variety of online research tools to update and validate records. Process Automation: Assist in evaluating opportunities to streamline manual data entry through reports, validation rules, or basic automation tools within Salesforce. Analytics & Insights: Support the development of dashboards or reports that help leadership visualize key metrics, such as sales pipeline health, lead conversion rates, or customer engagement trends. Documentation & Best Practices: Help document data management standards and create easy-to-follow guides for users to support consistency across teams. Participate in other projects or tasks as assigned What You’ll Gain By the end of the internship, you will have developed valuable skills that can support future careers in sales operations, data analytics, or CRM administration: Hands-on experience managing data in Salesforce CRM A deeper understanding of sales and marketing operations in a corporate environment Exposure to data analytics, business intelligence, and reporting tools Insight into data governance, quality assurance, and system integration Collaboration with cross-functional teams, including Sales, Marketing, and IT About You (Qualifications) We’re looking for a detail-oriented, analytical problem-solver who’s eager to learn and contribute in a fast-paced business environment. Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Information Systems, or related field with an expected graduation date after August 2026 Strong interest in sales operations, data management, or CRM systems Familiarity with Excel or Google Sheets; exposure to Salesforce, Power BI, or similar data tools is a plus Excellent attention to detail and comfort working with large data sets Strong written and verbal communication skills Proactive, curious, and eager to learn from others Why Join Us? Work on real projects that impact business decisions Gain hands-on experience with Salesforce, one of the world’s most widely used CRM platforms Receive mentorship from experienced professionals in data management and sales operations Be part of a collaborative, growth-oriented culture where your ideas are valued About the team: Our sales operations team is comprised of an amazing group of professionals who support and encourage each other every day. We’re excited to have another person share their ideas and help us scale to meet the needs of our growing business.Who you will be working for Ever.Ag offers innovative AgTech solutions and services that empower agriculture, food, and beverage supply chains to feed a growing world. The breadth of the portfolio is uniquely capable of supporting the complex needs of companies involved in dairy, livestock, crops, and agribusiness. With decades of experience and industry-leading innovations, our technology, risk management, and market intelligence provide our customers with the tools and insights they need to operate more efficiently, sustainably, and strategically across every stage of the supply chain. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds to contribute their unique perspectives to our team. Your success is our success! Please visit our webpage to learn more about us News.Ever.Ag and https://www.ever.ag/ Please note, at this time, Ever.Ag does not hire candidates residing in California, Hawaii, or Alaska.
